docs.title: Home
docs.text: This is the home page. The sidebar has links to different example pages that can be made. The root page must be called index.md

docs.title: API
docs.text: This page has automatically created descriptions of methods in the code

docs.title: testclass.py
docs.text:
Here are the methods of the class TestClass inside the file testclass.py

Source code in src/testclass.py 
class TestClass:
    def __init__(self):
        '''
        A constructor
        '''
        self.a = "a"

    def method(self):
        '''
        A method
        '''
        print(self.a)

docs.title: __init__()
docs.text:
A constructor

Source code in src/testclass.py 
def __init__(self):
    '''
    A constructor
    '''
    self.a = "a"

docs.title: method()
docs.text:
A method

Source code in src/testclass.py 
def method(self):
    '''
    A method
    '''
    print(self.a)

docs.title: test.py
docs.text: Here is a single function inside the file test.py:

docs.title: func(a: str, b: int)
docs.text:
A function

Source code in src/test.py 
def func(a : str, b : int):
    '''
    A function
    '''
    print(a + b)

docs.title: docs-test
docs.text: Testing making a documentation website using different packages and hosted on GitHub pages

docs.title: MkDocs
docs.text:
Installation:

pip install mkdocs

pip install mkdocstrings-python Lets you automatically include docstrings, method signatures, etc of code

pip install markdown-include Lets you include markdown files in other markdown files to reduce copy-pasting

pip install mkdocs-jupyter Lets you include Jupyter notebooks as pages

pip install mkdocs-material Provides a nicer theme and a lot of additional options

docs.title: Example notebook
docs.text:
First we import our packages

In [1]: Copied! 
import numpy as np
import numpy as np

Then we run some code

In [2]: Copied! 
a = np.std([1, 2, 3])
print(a)
a = np.std([1, 2, 3]) print(a) 
0.816496580927726
In [ ]: Copied!

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text: To get started you should download the code and look at the API and look at the notebook.
